content: Yes, as an expert in neuroscience, I am aware of Andrew Huberman. Dr. Andrew Huberman is a neuroscientist and tenured professor at Stanford University School of Medicine, where he directs the Huberman Lab. Dr. Huberman's research focuses on the neural basis of vision and the regulation of the stress response. He is known for his research on the neural mechanisms that underlie the regulation of stress, the neural basis of vision, and the neural mechanisms that underlie the regulation of sleep and wakefulness. Dr. Huberman is also well known for his TED talks and popular science communication on topics related to neuroscience, sleep and stress. He is also a frequent speaker and expert on the topics of sleep, stress, vision, and neuroscience.
